author: sky.cactus
content:
<@425279588009246720> re <https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2699>
That EIP does too much in a single EIP which is why I created 3 separate EIPs that define each of the individual new standards.  I don't think 1193 should be moved to final, as it is just a monolithic duplicate of those other 3 essentially.

author: sky.cactus
content: However, as an editor it is only my job to advise, so it is up to the authors to decide whether they agree or not, and I haven't heard back from them.

author: sky.cactus
content: If we hear nothing from the authors, I think we should mark as abandoned, not final.

author: axic3354
content: Not that I am happy with 1193, but the rules around final are vague, as discussed earlier this week. It seems mostly it covers that the text will not change, but nothing more. Following that they should be allowed to be final.

author: sky.cactus
content: I agree they should be *allowed* final and if the authors want it I definitely don't think we should stop them.

author: axic3354
content: I wish we would review these rules and come up with something better before, and halting non-draft merging til it is resolved.

author: sky.cactus
content: However, last I spoke with them they are unsure if that is what they want (was in Discord).

author: axic3354
content: Can you please leave that as a comment?

author: axic3354
content: I think 1193 should have left in its broken state and better standards be provided. I had some ideas/suggestions myself, but did not submit anything due to lack of time, more aligned with what you ended up doing.

author: axic3354
content: It is annoying typin on a phone for discord, this text field is tiny

author: axic3354
content: Anyway got pending PR count below 200 so I am happy

author: sky.cactus
content: Well done!

author: sky.cactus
content: Re: 2827 and 2828, I was *hoping* to get them marked as Withdrawn since it sounded like we wanted to move that direction.  <@!425279588009246720> do you think it is unrealistic for me to wait for that status?

author: sky.cactus
content: Alternatively, if the goal is to get PR count down I could close the PRs and wait for the editors to agree on the Withdrawn status just so we don't have outstanding PRs.

author: axic3354
content: I had a lenghty debate regarding these statuses in May on a call. I have a proposal with that convo in mind, will post tomorrow (~10 hrs from now).

author: axic3354
content: I need to switch off now :)

author: sky.cactus
content: Is it reasonable for me to wait to hear your proposal before addressing your request to change those PRs to abandoned?

author: axic3354
content: At this point leaving that PR open for another few days makes no difference

author: sky.cactus
content: I support your desire to cleanup open PRs, so I'm willing to commit to either closing the PR or switching to abandoned or merging the PR after I hear your proposal tomorrow.  üôÇ

author: sky.cactus
content: If none of the other authors reply to my comment on https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2699 feel free to merge it tomorrow.  It hurts my soul a bit to have a monolithic duplicate like that but I think sticking to the process is more important in this case (where the process is that the EIP authors get to decide, not editors).

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't *think* ryanio understands why I'm objecting, but I have *really* struggled to get engagement from the authors of that EIP over the last several months so I think waiting on more replies is unlikely to result in any progress.

author: sky.cactus
content: <@!543900561460822016> Can you help me understand <https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2934>?  I feel like I must be missing something, because I don't understand why you opened up a duplicate EIP here, especially if you don't plan on pursuing the EIP yourself.

author: sky.cactus
content: It makes sense to press for 2751 to be merged as a draft (and I agree it should be), but I don't understand why you opened a separate EIP.  Is the issue that you believe that the author has abandoned 2751?

author: sky.cactus
content: <@456226577798135808> Can you address the PR review from lightclient here https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2751#pullrequestreview-439253388 so we can merge that PR?  Keep in mind, Draft EIPs do not have to be finished, the idea is that once you have the basic idea and the structure of the document is correct it gets merged as draft and then you iterate on it over time.  Alternatively, if you are no longer interested in pursuing the issue at this time can you close the PR?

author: lightclient
content: I don‚Äôt have write access, so to fix the spelling errors I needed to create a new PR. The desire to remove selfdestruct has been increasing lately and I didn‚Äôt want to bother <@456226577798135808> for a few small edits

author: sky.cactus
content: Eh, it doesn't take much effort to click the commit button on those nifty little \`\`\`suggestion things you do.  My general opinion is that all EIPs should have a champion as an author who is willing to put forth some effort to push the EIP forward.

author: sky.cactus
content: If Alexey doesn't want to pursue it, then I think we need to find a new champion, rather than merging in an EIP without a champion.

author: sky.cactus
content: I feel like there are a number of EIP "rules" in the template that I don't get the *impression* that any of the current EIP editors actually agree with, yet we continue to follow them because "thems the rules".  I think it is fine to follow the rules until we make a change, but it is unclear to me why making a change to the rules is taking so long when from what I can tell there isn't any disagreement with the change.

author: sky.cactus
content: I *suspect* the issue is because we are trying to revamp the entire EIP process in one monolithic push, and all of the agreeable changes that we want are getting blocked for extended periods of time because we do disagree on few points in the monolithic change set.

author: sky.cactus
content: I wonder if there is a path we can follow where we can knock out some of the agreeable changes (or find out that there is real disagreement among the editors) and then take the longer approach to dealing with the more contentious stuff.

author: axic3354
content: I'm all for being more agile and applying rule changes, to get us out from this deadlock.

author: axic3354
content: Been late today, but did not forget the abandoned/withdrawn question üôÇ

content: Today == tomorrow, but yeah.  I have a list of emails to get through in the morning, including yours.
